name: Emotional Resilience
description: The ability to bounce back from setbacks and cope with stress in a healthy way. Emotional resilience helps individuals face challenges with confidence and maintain a positive outlook.
examples: Taking deep breaths and staying calm during a tough situation.
Seeking help from a trusted adult when feeling overwhelmed.
Learning from mistakes instead of giving up.

name: Self-Respect
description: Valuing yourself and believing that you deserve kindness and fairness. Self-respect forms the foundation for healthy relationships and responsible behavior.
examples: Standing up for yourself politely when treated unfairly.
Taking care of your body and mind.
Saying no to things that make you uncomfortable.

name: Self-Awareness
description: Understanding your own emotions, thoughts, and values and how they influence your actions. Self-awareness helps individuals make better decisions and develop a strong sense of identity.
examples: Recognizing when you are feeling angry or sad.
Reflecting on why you reacted a certain way in a situation.
Knowing what makes you happy or upset.

name: Growth Mindset
description: Believing that your abilities and intelligence can grow with effort and practice. A growth mindset encourages perseverance and a love of learning.
examples: Trying again after failing a math test.
Saying 'I can’t do it yet' instead of 'I can’t do it'.
Being excited to learn new things, even if they’re hard.

name: Taking Initiative
description: Taking action without being told and being proactive in solving problems. It shows leadership and responsibility.
examples: Starting your homework without being reminded.
Helping a classmate clean up without being asked.
Coming up with a plan to improve your reading skills.

name: Relationship Building
description: Creating and maintaining healthy and supportive connections with others. It involves communication, trust, and cooperation.
examples: Making a new student feel welcome.
Working well in a group project.
Apologizing when you've hurt someone’s feelings.

name: Decision Making
description: Making thoughtful and responsible choices after considering possible consequences. It helps in achieving goals and solving problems effectively.
examples: Thinking before speaking when angry.
Choosing to study for a test instead of watching TV.
Asking for advice before making a big decision.

name: Critical Thinking
description: Analyzing information logically, questioning assumptions, and making reasoned judgments. Critical thinking encourages curiosity and problem-solving.
examples: Asking why something happens instead of just accepting it.
Comparing different points of view before forming an opinion.
Looking for evidence before believing a rumor.

name: Empathy
description: The ability to understand and share the feelings of others. Empathy strengthens relationships and promotes kindness and compassion.
examples: Comforting a friend who is feeling sad.
Putting yourself in someone else’s shoes during a disagreement.
Listening carefully when someone is sharing a problem.
